channel.title: Cyanogen Mod
channel.description:
So I just installed Cyanogen Mod 7.0.3 on my Moto Droid, and I've been having a few problems with it. First, the phone never vibrates now, even though I have it configured to. It doesn't vibrate when I get a txt, call, anything. The other problem I've been having is with the physical keyboard. Most keys work right, but then the rest are acting as short cuts. Like the "E" key opens the Email apk, L opens the Calendar, etc. I've looked through the settings, and I can't find anything that would do this. So my question is, has anyone else had problems with this?
Edit: My dad also just informed me that he's sent me about 3 txts in the past 15 minutes, and none of them came through. Apparently that is also a common problem with Cyanogen on the Moto Droid... So another question, is Cyanogen an over-hyped pile of shit?
Alright, so after searching on the Cyanogen forums for a bit, I think I've got all these things fixed.

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:394971”]Turns out I was actually running 7.0.2, and still am, with no problems. But I just installed 7.0.3 on my wife’s phone and I’m having the same problems you did with the hardware keyboard, do you mind linking me to how you fixed it?

edit:
I’ve found out the keyboard shortcuts can be ‘fixed’ by pressing the search button (odd?) or by going to settings -> apps -> quick launch, so hopefully that is a permanent fix.

Also sometimes 3g would stop working, and that can be temporarily fixed by enabling airplane mode then disabling it again, I’d like to find a permanent solution for that.[/quote]

I’ve had the 3g problem on my myTouch Slide since cm 7 rc1, and there is still no fix (currently running 7.0.3)

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:394971”]Turns out I was actually running 7.0.2, and still am, with no problems. But I just installed 7.0.3 on my wife’s phone and I’m having the same problems you did with the hardware keyboard, do you mind linking me to how you fixed it?

edit:
I’ve found out the keyboard shortcuts can be ‘fixed’ by pressing the search button (odd?) or by going to settings -> apps -> quick launch, so hopefully that is a permanent fix.

Also sometimes 3g would stop working, and that can be temporarily fixed by enabling airplane mode then disabling it again, I’d like to find a permanent solution for that.[/quote]
Yea, I just noticed the 3g problem the other day… turning airplane mode on & off is a good thing to know, I just restarted the phone…

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

I used to have the problem that my phone wouldnt vibrate so I just updated my HTC Hero to the newest Cyanogen at the time and it’s been working. 6.1.0-Hero

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Turns out I was actually running 7.0.2, and still am, with no problems. But I just installed 7.0.3 on my wife’s phone and I’m having the same problems you did with the hardware keyboard, do you mind linking me to how you fixed it?

edit:
I’ve found out the keyboard shortcuts can be ‘fixed’ by pressing the search button (odd?) or by going to settings -> apps -> quick launch, so hopefully that is a permanent fix.

Also sometimes 3g would stop working, and that can be temporarily fixed by enabling airplane mode then disabling it again, I’d like to find a permanent solution for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I have Applanet (Android’s Installous) on my phone, so every app is free

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You don’t need to use SetCPU (it’s not free), you can use the built in overclocking in cyanogenmod, or ‘Milestone OC’, both which work great.

I don’t even have to overclock my phone anymore, it works great!

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:394971”]I’ve been running Cyanogenmod on my Droid since 5, and most recently with 7.0.3. It works like a brand new phone, but I did do a full wipe on the last upgrade because the RC3 was very sluggish, though probably due to never wiping before and having a million useless apps on there.

So if you install it and do a full factory wipe at the same time, you probably wouldn’t have any problems at all.

Also, I thought you had a Droid 2? Do you have the original Moto Droid, or the Droid 2? (which isn’t supported)[/quote]
I have the Moto Droid (the first one), and I wiped the data & cache when I installed it, or whatever ROM Manager does. So I’m not sure why I was getting the problems, however I’m pretty sure the phone not vibrating was just some default settings that I accidentally skipped over. The problem with the physical keyboard opening things, is apparently the phone thinks that the search button was hit when you opened the phone, so just hitting the search key fixes that. (Temporarily at least). I’m not sure what was causing the problem with messages not coming through, but it was easily fixed by checking Settings>CyanogenMod settings>Performance>Lock messaging app in memory.

Other than those few things though, CyanogenMod has been extremely good. Using SetCPU to OC my phone has been pretty nice too, and I have noticed quite a difference with the phone not being as sluggish.

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I bought 2 (supposedly) new batteries for my Droid (should be the same for your milestone) from ebay for like $2 each, they don’t last as long as the original battery (on average 10-12 hours instead of 24), but they are cheap enough you can buy a few of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

ive started using CM for Milestone (cause it aint supported) and its amazing.
saved me from getting a new phone, cept i still need a new battery. it lasts 6 hours maybe?
the overclocking doesn’t help

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve been running Cyanogenmod on my Droid since 5, and most recently with 7.0.3. It works like a brand new phone, but I did do a full wipe on the last upgrade because the RC3 was very sluggish, though probably due to never wiping before and having a million useless apps on there.

So if you install it and do a full factory wipe at the same time, you probably wouldn’t have any problems at all.

Also, I thought you had a Droid 2? Do you have the original Moto Droid, or the Droid 2? (which isn’t supported)

Read full topic

item.title: Cyanogen Mod
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Its actually pretty nice. The problems are all easily fixed too (with the exception of the physical keyboard acting like a shortcut, which is only a temporary fix). The other two were just changing a few settings around.

Read full topic

How is Cyanogen after the problems are fixed? I’m looking at putting it on my San Francisco/ZTE Blade.

item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

So I just installed Cyanogen Mod 7.0.3 on my Moto Droid, and I’ve been having a few problems with it. First, the phone never vibrates now, even though I have it configured to. It doesn’t vibrate when I get a txt, call, anything. The other problem I’ve been having is with the physical keyboard. Most keys work right, but then the rest are acting as short cuts. Like the “E” key opens the Email apk, L opens the Calendar, etc. I’ve looked through the settings, and I can’t find anything that would do this. So my question is, has anyone else had problems with this?

Edit: My dad also just informed me that he’s sent me about 3 txts in the past 15 minutes, and none of them came through. Apparently that is also a common problem with Cyanogen on the Moto Droid… So another question, is Cyanogen an over-hyped pile of shit?

Alright, so after searching on the Cyanogen forums for a bit, I think I’ve got all these things fixed.
